results.title: Tout va bien
results.creator_credit: Jean-Pierre Gorin, Jean-Luc Godard, Empire Films, Vicco Films and Anouchka Films
results.brief_description: An American broadcaster and a former film director go to a factory to interview the manager about modern managerial methods and find it occupied by the workers who take them hostage. Supporters of the working class and student uprising that took place in France in 1968, they are forced to re-examine their commitment to the struggle and to each other. The film wittily examines the position of three major social forces in French society and the contradictions between them: the bourgeoisie, the working class and intellectuals. The basic concern is the part an intellectual can play in revolutionary movement of the working class. Cast includes Yves Montand and Jane Fonda.

results.title: Touch the Sun: Peter and Pompey
results.creator_credit: Michael Carson, Margot McDonald and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Peter, Margaret and Wayne discover a Roman boat in a cave that contains the manuscript of young Pompey. The discovery changes the tiny little town of Gamma into a brash, hyped-up tourist centre. The children also find that their lives change too - and they don’t like what is happening. The manuscript found in the boat reveals that the boat is cursed and, until the boat is destroyed it will continue to curse anyone who comes into contact with it. The children decide that in order to save Gamma they must finally carry out the drastic act of destroying the boat.

results.title: Toot, whistle, plunk and boom
results.brief_description: Animated cartoons show the origin and development of musical instruments. Professor Owl tells his class how all music comes from a toot (the horns), whistle (woodwinds), plunk (strings) and boom (percussion). Explains how the complex instruments of the modern symphony orchestra and brass band developed from primitive forms and the effect of various refinements such as the valves on the brass horn.

results.title: Tongpan
results.brief_description: This documentary re-enactment made following the 1973 student rebellion which toppled the military junta in Thailand, is based on the experiences of a farmer from the poverty stricken north eastern region. It portrays the political and cultural gap that exists between peasant realities and the good intentions of the intelligentsia. In Thai with English subtitles.

results.title: Tokyo Joe
results.creator_credit: Stuart Heisler, Robert Lord and Santana Pictures
results.brief_description: Joe Barrett (Humphery Bogart) returns to Japan after World War II in the hope of piecing his life back together. Joe was told his wife, Trina (Florence Marly), died during her internment in Japan. However, on arrival he learns that she is alive and married to lawyer Mark Landis (Alexander Knox) and that the child they are raising could be his. Joe, still in love with Trina vows to get her back. In order to stay in Japan, he applies for an airline franchise. He is introduced to Baron Kimura (Sessue Hayakawa) who agrees to assist with the application in return for a partnership in the business. Soon, Kimura is blackmailing Joe into smuggling war criminal back into Japan, otherwise he will reveal that Trina participated in anti-American broadcasts on Japanese radio during the war. Produced by Bogart’s company, Santana Pictures, ‘Tokyo Joe’ was the first film to be granted permission by the Army authorities to be shot in US-occupied Japan. This production marks the return of actor Sessue Hayakawa to the American screen after a 20 year interruption.

results.title: Titsiana Booberini
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Robert Luketic
results.brief_description: Innovative, highly amusing tale of the ugly duckling who turns into a swan. Tania Lacy shines as the very plain, painfully shy and awkward shop assistant who has a crush on the Store Manager. Sophie Lee is equally as good as the bitchy beautiful shop assistant who gets everything her way. Presented as a musical, with ballet-like dance sequences, this quirky film is a classic tale which shows that beauty is, after all, only skin deep. Titsiana’s singing voice is provided by Sarah Liversidge.

results.title: THX 1138
results.creator_credit: George Lucas, Lawrence Sturhahn and American Zoetrope
results.brief_description: A future society of sophisticated technology in a subterranean city. Each individual has a number, not a name. Human responses and inclinations are suppressed by constant surveillance, robot policeman, and a diet of tranquiliser drugs. A couple break the rules, conceive a child and are put in prison where they meet a man who claims to know an escape route. Starring Robert Duvall, Donald Pleasence and Maggie McOmie.

results.title: Thunderbolt and Lightfoot
results.creator_credit: Michael Cimino, Robert Daley, Malpaso Company and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A golden field of wheat waves serenely under a blue Montana sky. A congregation of just-plain-folks in a quaint wooden church listens intently to the preacher. Then, just when you begin to wonder if you’ve somehow wandered into a Norman Rockwell painting, a man steps through the door and begins spraying the pulpit with automatic pistol fire. Clint Eastwood and Jeff Bridges star in this offbeat saga of a colourful group of bank robbers determined to “re-pull” a master heist of the fortress-like Montana Armoured Depository. In his directorial debut, Cimino injects the comedy-drama with an inventiveness and unpredictability rarely seen in the caper genre. Bridges received a Best Supporting Actor Academy Award nomination for his performance as Lightfoot.

results.title: Thunderball (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Kevin McClory, Danjaq, Eon Productions, Terence Young and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: Thunderball is the fourth Bond film with Sean Connery playing British secret service agent 007, pitting his stylish form against the espionage organisation SPECTRE (Special Executive for Counter-Terrorism, Revenge and Extortion), with Emilio Largo at the helm. SPECTRE plans to hijack a nuclear bomb, plant it under the sea, and then hold the world for ransom. Set in the Bahamas, “Thunderball” provides plenty of lush scenery with spectacular beaches, sprawling mansions and beautiful women in bathing costumes. The under water setting allows for some spectacular ideas and elaborate set pieces. Typical Bond touches include a myriad of one liners and nubile lady friends including a masseuse; Largo’s mistress; a British spy; and an enemy agent. Highlights include a Mardi Gras sequence with James evading capture due to a frenetic, chaotic moment. Other fine moments are the irascible Q displaying Bond’s latest gadgets whilst whingeing about being dragged to the Bahamas in order to do so. Re-made in 1993 as “Never say never again.”

results.title: The Woman Suffers
results.creator_credit: Raymond Longford and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: This 1918 Australian feature is one of the most significant surviving treasures of a silent film heritage which is now largely extinct. The story takes the concept of primitive justice - an eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth - and extends it to a sister for a sister. Ralph Manton discovers that his sister Marjory has been seduced and demands to be told the name of the man. Faithful to her lover, she refuses, but later Ralph discovers his identity and confronts him. The tables are turned. Starring Australia’s first film star, Lottie Lyell, the film was a critical and commercial success and offered audiences more than just a melodrama. It questioned the social mores of the day and the double standards of morality in regard to the men as the seducers. Musical accompaniment is by members of the Canberra Symphony Orchestra, conducted by composer Donald Hollier.
